Description: Lip and floor sherd (mended from six fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian) Late Wild Goat pottery plate; brown clay with white inclusions and porous surface; exterior: three bands near rim, one central on wall, three near foot; interior: white slip; three friezes divided by bands with added red lines edged in white; from outside: hook meander, lotus and bud chain, central star of lozenges and buds with dot-rosettes as filling ornament; ancient repair holes near edge of lip.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Cambridge NA47, NA52, and British Museum 1886,0401.1309.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.761)
